00036 void b3LauncherCL::setBuffer( cl_mem clBuffer)
00037 {
00038                 if (m_enableSerialization)
00039                 {
00040                         b3KernelArgData kernelArg;
00041                         kernelArg.m_argIndex = m_idx;
00042                         kernelArg.m_isBuffer = 1;
00043                         kernelArg.m_clBuffer = clBuffer;
00044                 
00045                         cl_mem_info param_name = CL_MEM_SIZE;
00046                         size_t param_value;
00047                         size_t sizeInBytes = sizeof(size_t);
00048                         size_t actualSizeInBytes;
00049                         cl_int err;
00050                         err = clGetMemObjectInfo (      kernelArg.m_clBuffer,
00051                                                                           param_name,
00052                                                                           sizeInBytes,
00053                                                                           &param_value,
00054                                                                           &actualSizeInBytes);
00055                         
00056                         b3Assert( err == CL_SUCCESS );
00057                         kernelArg.m_argSizeInBytes = param_value;
00058                         
00059                         m_kernelArguments.push_back(kernelArg);
00060                         m_serializationSizeInBytes+= sizeof(b3KernelArgData);
00061                         m_serializationSizeInBytes+=param_value;
00062             }
00063             cl_int status = clSetKernelArg( m_kernel, m_idx++, sizeof(cl_mem), &clBuffer);
00064                 b3Assert( status == CL_SUCCESS );
00065 }

00102 struct b3KernelArgDataUnaligned

00105     int m_argIndex;

00107         int m_unusedPadding;
00108     union

00119 int b3LauncherCL::deserializeArgs(unsigned char* buf, int bufSize, cl_context ctx)
00120 {
00121     int index=0;
00122     
00123     int numArguments = *(int*) &buf[index];
00124     index+=sizeof(int);
00125     
00126     for (int i=0;i<numArguments;i++)
00127     {
00128         b3KernelArgDataUnaligned* arg = (b3KernelArgDataUnaligned*)&buf[index];
00129 
00130         index+=sizeof(b3KernelArgData);
00131         if (arg->m_isBuffer)
00132         {
00133             b3OpenCLArray<unsigned char>* clData = new b3OpenCLArray<unsigned char>(ctx,m_commandQueue, arg->m_argSizeInBytes);
00134             clData->resize(arg->m_argSizeInBytes);
00135             
00136             clData->copyFromHostPointer(&buf[index], arg->m_argSizeInBytes);
00137             
00138             arg->m_clBuffer = clData->getBufferCL();
00139             
00140             m_arrays.push_back(clData);
00141             
00142             cl_int status = clSetKernelArg( m_kernel, m_idx++, sizeof(cl_mem), &arg->m_clBuffer);
00143                 b3Assert( status == CL_SUCCESS );
00144             index+=arg->m_argSizeInBytes;
00145         } else 
00146         {
00147             cl_int status = clSetKernelArg( m_kernel, m_idx++, arg->m_argSizeInBytes, &arg->m_argData);
00148                 b3Assert( status == CL_SUCCESS );
00149         }
00150                 b3KernelArgData b;
00151                 memcpy(&b,arg,sizeof(b3KernelArgDataUnaligned));
00152         m_kernelArguments.push_back(b);
00153     }
00154 m_serializationSizeInBytes = index;
00155     return index;
00156 }

00158 int b3LauncherCL::validateResults(unsigned char* goldBuffer, int goldBufferCapacity, cl_context ctx)
00159   {
00160          int index=0;
00161       
00162       int numArguments = *(int*) &goldBuffer[index];
00163       index+=sizeof(int);
00164 
00165         if (numArguments != m_kernelArguments.size())
00166         {
00167                 printf("failed validation: expected %d arguments, found %d\n",numArguments, m_kernelArguments.size());
00168                 return -1;
00169         }
00170       
00171       for (int ii=0;ii<numArguments;ii++)
00172       {
00173           b3KernelArgData* argGold = (b3KernelArgData*)&goldBuffer[index];
00174 
00175                 if (m_kernelArguments[ii].m_argSizeInBytes != argGold->m_argSizeInBytes)
00176                 {
00177                         printf("failed validation: argument %d sizeInBytes expected: %d, found %d\n",ii, argGold->m_argSizeInBytes, m_kernelArguments[ii].m_argSizeInBytes);
00178                         return -2;
00179                 }
00180 
00181                 {
00182                         int expected = argGold->m_isBuffer;
00183                         int found = m_kernelArguments[ii].m_isBuffer;
00184 
00185                         if (expected != found)
00186                         {
00187                                 printf("failed validation: argument %d isBuffer expected: %d, found %d\n",ii,expected, found);
00188                                 return -3;
00189                         }
00190                 }
00191                 index+=sizeof(b3KernelArgData);
00192 
00193                 if (argGold->m_isBuffer)
00194           {
00195 
00196                         unsigned char* memBuf= (unsigned char*) malloc(m_kernelArguments[ii].m_argSizeInBytes);
00197                         unsigned char* goldBuf = &goldBuffer[index];
00198                         for (int j=0;j<m_kernelArguments[j].m_argSizeInBytes;j++)
00199                         {
00200                                 memBuf[j] = 0xaa;
00201                         }
00202 
00203                         cl_int status = 0;
00204                         status = clEnqueueReadBuffer( m_commandQueue, m_kernelArguments[ii].m_clBuffer, CL_TRUE, 0, m_kernelArguments[ii].m_argSizeInBytes,
00205                                            memBuf, 0,0,0 );
00206               b3Assert( status==CL_SUCCESS );
00207               clFinish(m_commandQueue);
00208 
00209                         for (int b=0;b<m_kernelArguments[ii].m_argSizeInBytes;b++)
00210                         {
00211                                 int expected = goldBuf[b];
00212                                 int found = memBuf[b];
00213                                 if (expected != found)
00214                                 {
00215                                         printf("failed validation: argument %d OpenCL data at byte position %d expected: %d, found %d\n",
00216                                                 ii, b, expected, found);
00217                                         return -4;
00218                                 }
00219                         }
00220 
00221               
00222               index+=argGold->m_argSizeInBytes;
00223           } else 
00224           {
00225                         
00226                         //compare content
00227                         for (int b=0;b<m_kernelArguments[ii].m_argSizeInBytes;b++)
00228                         {
00229                                 int expected = argGold->m_argData[b];
00230                                 int found =m_kernelArguments[ii].m_argData[b];
00231                                 if (expected != found)
00232                                 {
00233                                         printf("failed validation: argument %d const data at byte position %d expected: %d, found %d\n",
00234                                                 ii, b, expected, found);
00235                                         return -5;
00236                                 }
00237                         }
00238 
00239           }
00240       }
00241       return index;
00242 
00243 }

00245 int b3LauncherCL::serializeArguments(unsigned char* destBuffer, int destBufferCapacity)
00246 {
00247 //initialize to known values
00248 for (int i=0;i<destBufferCapacity;i++)
00249         destBuffer[i] = 0xec;
00250 
00251     assert(destBufferCapacity>=m_serializationSizeInBytes);
00252     
00253     //todo: use the b3Serializer for this to allow for 32/64bit, endianness etc        
00254     int numArguments = m_kernelArguments.size();
00255     int curBufferSize = 0;
00256     int* dest = (int*)&destBuffer[curBufferSize];
00257     *dest = numArguments;
00258     curBufferSize += sizeof(int);
00259     
00260     
00261     
00262     for (int i=0;i<this->m_kernelArguments.size();i++)
00263     {
00264         b3KernelArgData* arg = (b3KernelArgData*) &destBuffer[curBufferSize];
00265         *arg = m_kernelArguments[i];
00266         curBufferSize+=sizeof(b3KernelArgData);
00267         if (arg->m_isBuffer==1)
00268         {
00269             //copy the OpenCL buffer content
00270             cl_int status = 0;
00271             status = clEnqueueReadBuffer( m_commandQueue, arg->m_clBuffer, 0, 0, arg->m_argSizeInBytes,
00272                                          &destBuffer[curBufferSize], 0,0,0 );
00273             b3Assert( status==CL_SUCCESS );
00274             clFinish(m_commandQueue);
00275             curBufferSize+=arg->m_argSizeInBytes;
00276         }
00277         
00278     }
00279     return curBufferSize;
00280 }

00282 void b3LauncherCL::serializeToFile(const char* fileName, int numWorkItems)
00283 {
00284         int num = numWorkItems;
00285         int buffSize = getSerializationBufferSize();
00286         unsigned char* buf = new unsigned char[buffSize+sizeof(int)];
00287         for (int i=0;i<buffSize+1;i++)
00288         {
00289                 unsigned char* ptr = (unsigned char*)&buf[i];
00290                 *ptr = 0xff;
00291         }
00292 //      int actualWrite = serializeArguments(buf,buffSize);
00293               
00294 //      unsigned char* cptr = (unsigned char*)&buf[buffSize];
00295 //            printf("buf[buffSize] = %d\n",*cptr);
00296               
00297         assert(buf[buffSize]==0xff);//check for buffer overrun
00298         int* ptr = (int*)&buf[buffSize];
00299               
00300         *ptr = num;
00301               
00302         FILE* f = fopen(fileName,"wb");
00303         fwrite(buf,buffSize+sizeof(int),1,f);
00304         fclose(f);
00305 
00306         delete[] buf;
00307 }
